newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian jobs forecasts unlikely met - Treasury.
newsitem.headline: Australian jobs forecasts unlikely met - Treasury.

text.p: Australian Treasury secretary Ted Evans said on Thursday the government's current employment growth and unemployment forecasts for 1996/97 were unlikely to be met.
Asked if there was little chance that the forecast employment growth of 1.5 percent, issued in January's mid-year budget review, could be achieved, Evans said: "Yes."
Evans was giving evidence at a Senate committee on budget estimates.
He also said the projected average 8.5 percent unemployment rate for the June quarter of 1997 was unlikely to be met.
Asked if unemployment would exceed that forecast, Evans said: "That's not quite as clear, but the probabilities are that that would be the case."
Official Labor force statistics for April are due out later on Thursday.
Private sector economists, on average are expecting unemployment to remain at 8.7 percent and see an increase in employment of 31,000.
